Description: Append an identifer that is unique within your organization. This is essential if a device is recycled.
Comments: Devices might be reused, so the serial number will be the same. The only way to distinguish is by providing a unique name for the recycled product.

Description: Type of instrument
Example: archival, popup, satellite, acoustic tag, or acoustic receiver
Comments: Should be restricted to the examples provided.
Other notes: If any of the metadata can be populated by manufacter, we need to provide a "map" to connect the manufacturer names to our names here.  We should consider maping to possible device specification metadata record in http://cor.esipfed.org/ont#/  system (Vardis to investigate with MMI/COR -XDOMES project)

Description: Version number of the firmware used to build the device
Name of manufacturer
Example: Wildlife Computers, Microwave Telemetry, Lotek Wireless, Desert Star Systems, CEFAS, StarOddi, Sea Mammal Research Unit, Vemco, Loggerhead Instruments, Biologging Solutions, Little Leonardo, Teleonics etc.
Other notes: Some edits to the example list made by IATTC

Description: Model name
Contact email/ telephone/ address
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: Researcher/ organization owning the device
Comments: PI/scientist/organization is used interchargably here. But best to have a first-last name specified here.
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: Serial number
Date (yyyy-mm-dd) of receiving the device from manufacturer
Comments: The device can be fresh off the production line or refurnished with some parts replaced.

Description: Name or identifer for project/ grant number
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: Platform Transmitting Terminal (PTT) number for Argos transmission.
PTT in hexadecimal
Specification document name/ URL/ file (e.g., in xml)
Comments: Need input from manufacturer. May allow attachment or upload. Or grab it from an online archive.
Other notes: Possible device specification metadata record in http://cor.esipfed.org/ont#/  system

Description: Placeholder for acoustic tags
Comments: Refer to ATN spec.

Description: Placeholder for acoustic tags
Comments: Refer to ATN spec.

Description: File/ URL to a report listing the details of programming
Comments: Need input from manufacturer. May allow attachment or upload. Or grab it from an online archive.

Description: Programming software with version number
Days at a constant depth before release is initiated
Comments: This represents a time lag in days after the tag is  floating/ detached/ sunk before the release procedure will be initiated.

Description: Programmed mission length in days
Interval in minutes during when data are summarized for that period
Comments: Data are summarized because of Argos transmission constraint.

Description: Person responsible for the programming
Sampling rate (seconds) for sensor sampling
Comments: For basic sensors,  e.g., pressure, temperature, light

Description: Time interval in seconds when sampled data are written to onboard storage memory
Comments: This specifies how frequent data will be stored, and subsequently available for download or summarizing.

Description: Sampling rate (seconds) for sensor sampling at a higher frequency
Comments: For sensors that sample in Hertz (Hz),  e.g., accelerometer, magnetometer

Description: Method used to put the tag on/ in the animal
Example: tow, glue, suction, anchor, mount, implant, harness, backpack
Comments: Should be restricted to the examples provided. Tow includes tethered for popup or towed for satellite tags . Glue is using adhensive or epoxy. Mount is using screw, bolt, button, sleeve or backpack. Anchor is equivalent to applying a conventional tag or using a gun (air, spear etc.). Implant implies surgery, ingestion or insertion.

Description: How deep (centimeter) should the anchor be in the animal?
Comments: May be used for cetacean tagging.

Description: Dimensions (millimeter) as length, width, thichkness or diameter.
Comments: Can be used loosely as size: small, medium and large.

Description: Material of anchor
Type of anchor
Brand name and/ product for attachment materials used
Comments: Brand and product name of suture, stainless steel wire, monofilament, bolt, tape, adhesive, epoxy, suction cup, air gun, speargun, pole, applicator and tip.
Other notes: Comma separated. Some edits/additions to the example list made by IATTC

Description: Type of mount
Method to get a tag detached from the animal/ anchor
Example: corrosive burn wire, oxidative/ explosive, galavanizing metal, acoustic release

Description: Materials and methods in constructing a tether
Comments: Use brand name and/ product when possible.

Description: End to end length (centimeter) of a tether
Tether material for a towed tag
Comments: Use brand name and/ product when possible.

Description: Brand name and/ product of anesthesia used during the attachment
Brand name and/ product of antifoluling paint or coating applied
Brand name and/ product of antiseptic or sterilizing agent used during the attachment
Specify any additional floation used
Comments: Float might be added to archival tags for external use.

Description: If a mechanical release is engaged at depth (too avoid crushing the tag), specify the mechanism and depth at which the release is engaged.
Latitude (decimal degree) of release/ deployment
Longitude (decimal degree) of release/ deployment
Person responsible for tagging or surgery
Comments: Can be the name of vet, observer, crew, spear fisherman or scientist
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from  Recommended to Required)

Description: Local date time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) of release/ deployment
Comments: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

Description: Name or standard identifer of location
Type of gear used to catch the animal
Example: Longline, purse seine, troll, trawl, rod and reel, handline, set net, trap, gillnet, harpoon, hoop net, anesthesia, tangle net, dip net, vertical line entanglement (commercial fisheries, aquaculture, mooring), dredge, pound net/weir (for turtles)
Other notes:
http://www.spc.int/oceanfish/en/data-collection/241-data-collection-forms
https://www.iccat.int/en/ICCATManual.asp

Description: Bait, chum, lure or decoy used
Comments: Use brand name and/ product when possible.

Description: Name or standard identifer of cruise
Depth (meters) at which the animal was caught
Comments: Can use estimated depth from hook number on longline

Description: The vessels country of registration
Type of hook used
Comments: Use brand name and/ product when possible.
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Optional to Recommended)

Description: how was animal put aboard the vessel
List tag IDs for conventional, acoustic, PIT, band or satellite tags for multi-tagged situation, photoID, photo/video footage file names
Other notes: Comma separated.

Description: Person responsible for angling
Type of school in which the animal was caught
Example: Free school, log, anchored FAD, drifting FAD
Comments: Include FAD number if possible.

Description: World Meteorological Organization sea state code (0-9)
Comments: Similar to Douglas Sea Scale

Description: If caught on longline, include set number and float number
Comments: It's very unlikely to tag turtle, bird/ mammal off longline.

Description: Name or standard identifer of station
Air or sea surface temperature (Celcius) when the animal was caught
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Optional to Recommended)

Description: Name or standard identifer of vessel
Wind speed (knots) when the animal was caught
Description of condition/ injury. Or specify scoring system and a score.
Comments: Can be generic: good, bad, gut hooked, eye hooked, bleeding. Scoring system fof fish/ shark:  reflex action mortality predictor (RAMP), Kerstetter's lab ACES.  Measurement: Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA) gives phase angle and composition index. Fat: Distell Fatmeter
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Length of the animal
Method used to obtain the measurement
Example: measured caliper, measured tape,  estimated, calculated
Comments: Calculated means it's calculated from length-weight relationships or other conversions.
Other notes: Is this good enough? Or have to specify how the measurement is made: tape/ estimated etc.  Some edits/additions to the example list made by IATTC.  Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Type of length measurement
Example: Curved fork length, Straight fork length, total length.  for turtle the standard measurements are Curved Carapace Length (CCL), Straight Carapace Length (SCL), Curved Carapace Width (CCW) and Straight Carapace Width (SCW), and researchers occasionally measure girth as well.
Comments: May need to compile a list of types and abbreviations
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the example list made by IATTC. Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Unit of length measurement
Comments: May need to compile a list of types and abbreviations

Description: Common name(s) or FAO code for species name
Comments: Refer to www.itis.gov or FAO species list

Description: Taxononomic Serial Number (TSN) from Integrated Taxonomic Information System
Comments: https://www.itis.gov

Description: Description of condition/ injury. Or specify scoring system and a score.
Comments: Can be generic: good, bad, gut hooked, eye hooked, bleeding. Scoring system fof fish/ shark:  reflex action mortality predictor (RAMP), Kerstetter's lab ACES.  Measurement: Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA) gives phase angle and composition index. Fat: Distell Fatmeter

Description: Fate of the animal upon recapture
Example: harvested, released, tag and release, missing, unknown; observed/ photo ID

Description: Method used to obtain the measurement
Example: measured Caliper, measured tape, estimated, calculated
Comments: Calculated means it's calculated from length-weight relationships or other conversions
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Length of the animal
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Type of length measurement
Comments: May need to compile a list of types and abbreviations
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Unit of length measurement
Comments: May need to compile a list of types and abbreviations
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Required)

Description: Life stage of the animal
Life stage of the animal
Description of where the tag was placed.
Age from direct aging methods if available
Comments: Can be used to back calculate age of the individual at capture

Description: If caught on longline, specify soak time In hours
If caught on longline, specify soak time In hours
Number of suture used to close the wound
Comments: Internal archival only

Description: If caught on rod and wheel or handline, specify fight time
If caught on rod and wheel or handline, specify fight time
Time used (minutes) in carrying out the attachment or surgical procedure.
If the animal is revived, specify revival time in minutes
Comments: Can be time used in swimming the animal before release

Description: Number of bolts used for mounting
Sex of the animal
Comments: Likely only applicable to sharks upon visual confirmation

Description: Stock origin if known
List other sample types and sample IDs if collected
Comments: Tissue can be any issue: fin clip, blood, scale, biopsy etc.
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: List other sample types and sample IDs if collected
Comments: Tissue can be any issue: fin clip, blood, scale, hard parts, stomach, muscle, biopsy etc.
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: Weight of the animal
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Method used to obtain the measurement
Comments: Calculated means it's calculated from length-weight relationships or other conversions
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Method used to obtain the measurement
Comments: Calculated means it's calculated from length-weight relationships or other conversions
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Weight of the animal
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Type of weight measurement
Comments: May need to compile a list of types and abbreviations: whole, dressed, gilled & gutted
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Type of weight measurement
Comments: May need to compile a list of types and abbreviations: whole, dressed, gilled & gutted
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Unit of weight measurement
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: Friendly or public-facing name given to an individual tagged animal
Unit of weight measurement
Other notes: Some edits/additions to the Necessity made by IATTC (from Recommended to Optional)

Description: End date time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) or date range (BETWEEN yyyy-mm-dd AND yyyy-mm-dd) if estimated/ guessed.
Comments: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

Example: GPS, Argos, estimated, calculated, modeled, recovered on animal, floater at sea, animal died and sank, recovered on land, recovered by fishing fleet, recovered in port, transfer in transshipment, found in well number X, recovered in processing plant
Other notes: http://www.spc.int/TAGGING/en/publications/tagging-publications/viewcategory/13

Description: Description of how the end point is derived for the device.
Example: first reported, recaptured, last transmission, recovered

Description: End latitude
End longitude
Argos location class for popup location or satellite transmission
If mortality occurs before end datetime, specify date time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss)
Comments: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

Description: Name or standard identifer of location
Type of gear used to catch the animal
Example: Longline, purse seine, troll, trawl, rod and reel, handline, set net, trap, gillnet, harpoon, hoop net, anesthesia, tangle net, dip net, vertical line entanglement (commercial fisheries, aquaculture, mooring), dredge, pound net/weir (for turtles)

Description: Person responsible for the recapture
Comments: Name of angler, observer, scientist, fisher, beach comber etc.

Description: Bait, chum, lure or decoy used
Comments: Use brand name and/ product when possible

Description: Name or standard identifer of cruise
Depth (meters) at which the animal was caught
Comments: Can use estimated depth from hook number on longline

Description: The vessels country of registration
Type of hook used
Comments: Use brand name and/ product when possible.

Description: Person responsible for tag-and-release
Comments: Very unlikely to re-tag turtle or mammal

Description: List tag IDs for conventional, acoustic, PIT, band or satellite tags for multi-tagged situation, photoID, photo/video footage file names
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: Type of school in which the animal was caught
Example: Free school, log, anchored FAD, drifting FAD
Comments: Include FAD number if possible

Description: World Meteorological Organization sea state code (0-9)
Comments: Similar to Douglas Sea Scale

Description: If caught on longline, include set number and float number
Name or standard identifer of station
Air or sea surface temperature (Celcius) when the animal was caught
Name or standard identifer of vessel
Wind speed (knots) when the animal was caught
State the source for waypoints
Example: Argos, GPS, acoustic detections, manufacturer, modeled
Comments: Waypoints are "points" along the trajectory of the tagged animal between the start and end dates.

Description: List of Geocorrection Parameters and associated values implemented. Comma seperated list in format 'parameter1:value', 'parameter2:value',..
Comments: Assuming only 1 set of waypoints per tag data file.

Description: None if no interpolation. Otherwise, specify method/ software used.
Example: None, crawl, Bézier curves, Hermite splines and cubic splines

Description: Specify the time interval for interpolation
Comments: Use 0 for no interpolation or gap filling for data points without any coordinates.

Description: If "waypoints_source" = "modeled", specify the method used to estimate the positions. Include citation/ reference/ url if available
Example: kftrack, ukfsst, trackit, tripEstimation, SSM, GPE3, Track & Loc, GeoLight, BASTrack, IKNOS

Description: Software packages used with version number
URL/URI to any relevant geocorrection output file(s) produced
List available source(s) for other known position(s)
Comments: If an animal is tagged and then released again, this can be included here as well

Description: List chronologically the instruments collecting the ancillary position(s)
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: List chronologically the datetime (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) for ancillary position(s)
Comments: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: List chronologically the longitude for ancillary position(s)
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: List chronologically the latitude for ancillary position(s)
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: List chronologically the quality (location class/ accuracy/ range etc.) for ancillary position(s). Can be qualitative.
Comments: Can be Argos location class or general descriptions
Other notes: Comma separated

Description: Is there any problem found in this dataset? One of 3 responses: yes, no, unexamined.
Person responsible for quality control
Date range (BETWEEN yyyy-mm-dd AND yyyy-mm-dd) in which data quality is in doubt
Provide details for the problem(s)
Example: Daily drift after sunset by 1.5 degC

Description: Number of problems found
Comments: Hard to cover all problems here, e.g., date of post-release mortality/ predation, broken light stalk, broken hardware, tag failure modes

Description: List short description(s) for the problem(s)
Files/ URLs used for calibration of sensors
